steps.title: Buy a serum with a mix of molecule sizes to penetrate the skin.
steps.content: Buy a serum with a mix of molecule sizes to penetrate the skin. Hyaluronic acid molecules are normally too large to pass through the layers of the skin. [2] X Research source You’ll want to find a product that provides a variety of molecule sizes to get better benefits from topical application. Lower molecular weights can go deeper into the skin. Not all products list these, so it’s best to research online or ask the manufacturer for more details.

steps.title: Use a water-based serum if you have oily/combination skin.
steps.content: Use a water-based serum if you have oily/combination skin. This will help you avoid introducing too many unnecessary oils to your skin. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Find a water or oil-based serum for dry/normal skin.
steps.content: Find a water or oil-based serum for dry/normal skin. Topically applied, oil-based products will hold water on your dry skin’s surface and hydrate cells without blocking pores. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Test your product first to see if your skin reacts.
steps.content: Test your product first to see if your skin reacts. Apply hyaluronic acid somewhere discreet, like behind your ear to test the effect on your skin. [5] X Research source It is unlikely to cause a reaction as it occurs naturally in the body. Use once per day or every other day initially to ensure it’s safe in the long term

steps.title: Cleanse and tone your face as you normally would.
steps.content: Cleanse and tone your face as you normally would. Follow your regular skin cleansing routine up until before you add moisturizer. [6] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.

steps.title: Apply a thin layer of hyaluronic acid serum to damp skin.
steps.content: Apply a thin layer of hyaluronic acid serum to damp skin. Having moisture already on the skin allows your choose hyaluronic acid serum to be absorbed better. Hyaluronic acid works by retaining moisture, so you’ll need to give it something to work with. [7] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.

steps.title: Use hyaluronic acid serum in the morning and at night.
steps.content: Use hyaluronic acid serum in the morning and at night. In the morning, it can give your skin additional moisture to soften it throughout the day. Used at night time, hyaluronic acid will help replenish the moisture lost during your day’s activities. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a hyaluronic acid cream to lock in moisture.
steps.content: Choose a hyaluronic acid cream to lock in moisture. Since moisturizing creams sit on the surface of the skin, they work to hold moisture within the skin’s surface. Adding hyaluronic acid moisturizer to your existing skincare regime will give you the best results from your hyaluronic acid treatment. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Look for a concentration of at least 0.1% hyaluronic acid in your cream.
steps.content: Look for a concentration of at least 0.1% hyaluronic acid in your cream. Any less than this and you’ll reduce the effectiveness of the moisturizing cream. Studies show that this level of hyaluronic acid is effective for hydrating skin and maintaining skin elasticity. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source If you have sensitive skin, you may want to keep to lower strength hyaluronic acid formula so you don’t risk a reaction or dryness.

steps.title: Add hyaluronic acid to your existing moisturizer.
steps.content: Add hyaluronic acid to your existing moisturizer. If you have a moisturizer that works for your skin already, simply add hyaluronic acid to this to utilize its benefits. [11] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. Research the ingredients in your product to ensure you’ll achieve the correct concentration of hyaluronic acid.

steps.title: Apply as often as required.
steps.content: Apply as often as required. It is safe to use hyaluronic acid every time you follow your skincare routine. This will depend on your individual routine and requirements, but the addition of hyaluronic acid will not affect these timings.

steps.title: Consult a dermatologist to use hyaluronic acid for healing skin.
steps.content: Consult a dermatologist to use hyaluronic acid for healing skin. If you’re looking to heal lines or scars, ask a medical professional about hyaluronic acid dermal filler injections. Since this allows the hyaluronic acid to penetrate beneath the first layers of skin, it is a more effective way to heal skin on a molecular level. [12] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Choose a licensed healthcare provider.
steps.content: Choose a licensed healthcare provider. Do your research beforehand and ask about their experience with dermal injections, and discuss treatment options before going ahead with hyaluronic acid filler treatments. Ensure they are using approved substances, depending on your region’s laws.

steps.title: Know the risks of dermal fillers.
steps.content: Know the risks of dermal fillers. Side effects of hyaluronic acid fillers include redness, swelling, itching and pain at the injection site. In rare instances, you may experience more serious side effects, so it is important to discuss this with your healthcare provider and understand the risks.
